question: Will roon deactivate his account in February?
description:
On Feb 22 roon tweeted "sunsetting roon account" (see https://twitter.com/tszzl/status/1760822079950340572).

This market will resolve to “Yes” if roon (@tszzl) deactivates his account by February 29, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to “No”.

The deactivation must last at least 12 consecutive hours for this market to resolve to "Yes." Periods of deactivation that start on the last day will count (e.g. Feb 29 8 PM ET to March 1 8 AM ET). 

The resolution source for this market is https://twitter.com/tszzl/.

question: Will Uniswap's "Fee Switch" proposal pass?
description:
On Feb 23 a Uniswap proposal to switch its protocol fees was posted to its governance forum, stating if there were no major blockers, an on-chain vote would occur by March 8 (see https://gov.uniswap.org/t/rfc-activate-uniswap-protocol-governance/22936/1). 

This market will resolve to "Yes" if the first on-chain vote for Uniswap's "Protocol Fee Switch" proposal passes by April 30, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

This market refers to the result of the on-chain vote.  This market will resolve to "No" if no on-chain vote for this proposal finishes by the resolution date. If an on-chain vote commences and the vote results in "against" or otherwise does not pass, the market will immediately resolve to "No."

question: Will Trump win the Michigan Primary by more than 60% of the vote?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Donald J. Trump wins the 2024 Republican Michigan Primary by more than 60% of the popular vote (compared with the second place candidate). Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

If no 2024 Republican Michigan Primary takes place, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source for this market will be the first announcement of the results from the Michigan Republican party, however an overwhelming consensus of credible reporting may suffice.

events.title: Trump Margin of Victory in Michigan Primary?

question: Will Trump win the Michigan Primary by between 50-60% of the vote?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Donald J. Trump wins the 2024 Republican Michigan Primary by between 50% (inclusive) and 60% (inclusive) of the popular vote (compared with the second place candidate). Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

If no 2024 Republican Michigan Primary takes place, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source for this market will be the first announcement of the results from the Michigan Republican party, however an overwhelming consensus of credible reporting may suffice.

question: Will Trump mention Nikki Haley the most in South Carolina speech?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Donald Trump says "Nikki Haley", "Nikki" and "Haley", more times (in total) than any other listed word/phrase during his victory/losing speech for the South Carolina Republican primary scheduled for February 24, 2024. Otherwise this market will resolve to “No”.

Note: If he says "Nikki Haley" it will count as one mention. 

Listed words and phrases: “Nikki Haley/Nikki/Haley”, “Joe Biden/Joe/Biden”, “Border”, “Make America Great Again/MAGA”, “Rig”. Plural forms, possessives, and different tenses (i.e., "rigged" for "rig"), of the listed phrases will count toward the resolution of this market.
 
If no victory/losing speech is given by February 25, 2024 12:00 PM ET, this market group will resolve to the first listed word according to alphabetical order (i.e. Biden). If there is a tie for the most number of mentions, the market will resolve to the first word in alphabetical order (i.e. in a tie between “Biden” and “Haley”, this  market group would resolve “Yes” for “Biden”).

The resolution source is live video of the speech. In case of ambiguity, an official transcript and/or a consensus of credible reporting may also be considered.

events.title: Trump SC speech: what will he say most?

Listed words and phrases: “Nikki Haley/Nikki/Haley”, “Joe Biden/Joe/Biden”, “Border”, “Make America Great Again/MAGA”, “Rig”. Plural forms, possessives, and different tenses (i.e., "rigged" for "rig"), of the listed phrases will count toward the resolution of this market.

question: New mystery balloon shot down by Sunday?
description:
On February 23, 2024 it was reported that the military is tracking an unidentified high-altitude balloon over the western part of the United States: (https://www.cbsnews.com/news/military-tracking-balloon-western-us-military/)

This market will resolve to "Yes" if the new "mystery balloon" reported floating over US territory is shot out of the sky by any means by Sunday, February 25, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official statements made by the government of the United States of America, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

question: Will Ben Armstrong (Bitboy) get KO'd?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Ben Armstrong (Bitboy) loses his fight with More Light by KO/TKO. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

If for any reason the match is not scored, postponed after February 29, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, or cancelled, this market will resolve 50-50.

The primary resolution source for this market will be footage of the fight, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

question: Will Ben Armstrong and More Light go the distance?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Ben Armstrong and More Light go the distance in their fight scheduled for February 23, 2024. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

If for any reason the match is postponed until after February 29, 2024, 11:59 PM ET or cancelled, this market will resolve 50-50.

The primary resolution source for this market will be footage of the fight, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

question: Will Ben Armstrong (Bitboy) land any strikes?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Ben Armstrong (Bitboy) lands 1 or more strikes in his fight against More Light scheduled for February 23, 2024. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

If for any reason the match is postponed until after February 29, 2024, 11:59 PM ET or cancelled, this market will resolve 50-50.

The primary resolution source for this market will be footage of the fight and/or information from karate.com (https://karate.com/en/fighters/ben-armstrong), however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

question: Will Ben Armstrong (Bitboy) cry?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Ben Armstrong (Bitboy) cries at any point while on camera while at the venue of his fight with More Light scheduled for February 23, 2024. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purpose of this market, 'crying' is defined as the visible shedding of tears that can be clearly observed on Ben Armstrong's face. The 'crying' can take place at any time Ben Armstrong is on camera and present at the fight venue even if the fight isn't ongoing.

The primary resolution source for this market will be footage of the fight, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

If for any reason the match is postponed after February 29, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, or canceled, this market will resolve 50-50.
